The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.desc: A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a family whose once-loved home is now a wrecked shell, after an insurance claim made six years ago went disastrously wrong. Plus, the programme revisits a pledge made in 2018 by then-local government minister Rishi Sunak to keep private parking companies in check

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: An incident in which a train driver suffered facial injuries after a brick was hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train was travelling at 70mph, but the driver managed to bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries. Rav Wilding reports on how attacks like this have prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology, aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Officers work to bring a bogus coach company to justice after leaving hundreds of pensions stranded in Torquay, and also track down a loan shark targeting hard-up families

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin looks round a chalet-style bungalow in the Derbyshire village of Kilburn and a three-bedroom end terrace in Huthwaite, Nottinghamshire that offers a colourful reminder of his footballing past. Plus, a revisit to a church in Dover that Martin Roberts first saw five years ago

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the contest from Leominster in Herefordshire, with Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell as expert advisors. Eric also visits Hereford Cathedral's 17th-century library where the books are kept under lock and key

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Finn is away receiving treatment for his PTSD, so Concepta takes his place on a fishing trip with Shay and Barry. Their pleasure cruise goes horribly wrong, however, when the engine of their boat explodes, leaving one of the crew seriously injured

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne calls on help to exercise creative flair to an outdated armchair, while blacksmiths Bex and Dave are tasked with turning old scaffolding props into something special

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple to find a new home in Dorset on a budget of 550,000, and creates sustainable beauty products made from locally foraged plants and herbs

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as the dealers bid to buy a brass and copper antique diving helmet, a growling Steiff bear, a Basil Brush ride-on toy, a pair of scales and an old mangle

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Silversmith Brenton West repairs a boxing trophy won by an accomplished sportsman and much-loved grandfather. Larry Gaines fought professionally from 1923 and refused to let prejudice hamper his career. He was the first black boxer to fight in the Royal Albert Hall and his family is immensely proud of him. Also being restored are a pair of old football boots and a vintage globe. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England cricketer Tammy Beaumont, rugby league great Robbie Hunter-Paul, double Paralympic gold medallist Maisie Summers-Newton and former Bolton Wanderers footballer Fabrice Muamba join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Strictly judge Shirley Ballas, Dragon Steven Bartlett, presenter Josie Gibson and comedian Chris McCausland join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace bring knockout week to an end by challenging the 10 remaining cooks to serve up a dish that they can eat with their hands. The stakes are high because two of the hopefuls will be going home, leaving the other eight to move on to semi-final week

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts, as comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Dom and Kay struggle to meet the Brightmarsh Gang's payment deadline, so she comes up with a devious plan involving Youth Pastor Tomi's church fund to try and get the cash together for the pay off. Kay is adamant this money cannot be touched, but will Dom be able to persuade him to take it? Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome star guests and members of the public to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between, joined in this edition by father-and-son combo Michael and Jack Whitehall. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: It's a new start for Oly and Santi, with Jacinda starting kindy at Oly's old primary school. The grind of unexpected early parenthood has taken its toll, and they are separated and coparenting. Later, unexpected news spins Oly off her axis. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Santi reconsiders introducing Jacinda to his new girlfriend Keeks after she and Oly have intense reactions, while Vince and Angie navigate the consequences of being 'too nice'. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Weird Science (1985)
programme.desc: Two sexually frustrated teenagers use their computer to design the perfect woman, but are ill prepared for the outcome when their creation comes to life. She decides to make men of them, by putting them in a series of situations that will force them to stand up for themselves. John Hughes' sci-fi comedy, starring Kelly LeBrock, Anthony Michael Hall, Ilan Mitchell-Smith, Robert Downey Jr and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by writer and comedian Ben Elton, with chefs Sabrina Ghayour and Max La Manna. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Mary Berry - Love to Cook
programme.desc: In Carmarthen Bay, Mary and daughter Annabel meet forager Craig Evans. Armed with his vast knowledge of edible plants, they indulge in their two loves - the great outdoors and cooking. Mary then travels to Cumbria to meet Carlisle-born Harrison, whose friends helped him to turn his life around and discover solace through the great outdoors. Dishes include roast fillet of beef with fresh horseradish, served with a magical platter of vegetables

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Nottingham Forest v Arsenal and Manchester City v Chelsea

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts from Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, where experts Tim Weeks and Charles Hanson assist the reds and blues as they vie, hoping to make the greater profit at auction. Away from the contest, Charlie learns about one of the bravest British heroines of the 20th century

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Leeds Rhinos v Wigan Warriors (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Headingley Stadium. Wigan lifted the trophy last season, defeating Huddersfield Giants 16-14 in the final, while Leeds were eliminated at home to Castleford Tigers at this stage, but will be expecting to an improved performance this time around as they look to emulate their last triumph in the competition in 2020

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and brothers David and Harry Rich take on the job of redesigning an unusually shaped garden in Droitwich Spa, Worcestershire. Lionel loves firing up the BBQ to cook for the family, but he and wife Paulette also want a tranquil space to relax in. Can the designers come up with a zoned plot with plenty of screening that ticks all the boxes?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. In each episode, contestants are guided by a host of celebrity experts, with tonight's advice coming from Anton Du Beke, Josie Gibson, Iain Stirling, Kadeena Cox, Nigel Ng, Tony Blackburn and Emma Barnett

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are Sally Lindsay, Andi Oliver, Chris McCausland, Jimmy Carr, Sophie Ellis-Bextor and Melvin Odoom

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Phil Tufnell, Mark Butcher, Cece Lightfoot, Pooja Shah, Chris McCausland, Sarah Keyworth, Ritchie Neville and Scott Robinson try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jodie's drink is spiked during a night out, but she is able to call Rida for help. When she makes it to the emergency department, Faith offers her support, but a furious Max assumes she is drunk. Ryan feels he is not being given enough opportunity to prove his worth, while Teddy worries about asking Paige out

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker as DI Annika Strandhed, who has returned to Glasgow to head up the Marine Homicide Unit, where she is tasked with solving puzzling crimes and unexplained murders that wash up in Scotland's waters. On her first day in a new role, Annika is called in to solve the murder of a man found in the Clyde, with a harpoon piercing his head

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Bournemouth v Manchester United at Vitality Stadium and Nottingham Forest v Arsenal at The City Ground and Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield, as valuable points were up for grabs at both ends of the table. Plus, Tottenham Hotspur v Brentford, Fulham v Crystal Palace and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Everton

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards count down those Premier League players most adept at using sly tactics to gain an advantage

programme.title: The Mercy (2017)
programme.desc: The story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe in 1968. The struggles he confronted on the controversial voyage, while his family awaited his return, is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times. Factual drama, starring Colin Firth, David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: The team head to Beaconsfield Recycling Centre for items to upcycle. Jacqui finds a tired toolbox to transform, Sarah takes on a glass bookcase and Bruce finds a dated sideboard

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits Cornwall where she has some homes lined up to tempt a buyer from suburban Surrey who is looking for a fresh start for him and his grandson

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by TV presenters Laura Whitmore and Gethin Jones, actress Meera Syal and actor Joe Thomas, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Old God's Time by Sebastian Barry, and My Family And Other Animals by Gerald Durrell

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood presents the story of an anxious family's 999 call to the police as they watched an intruder prowling around downstairs, live on their home security camera

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin meet the Waltons in Nottinghamshire, a family with a high-sugar diet that is having a serious impact on their health and their bank balance. Couple Rita and Pete have both been diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes, and Gregg and Chris are stunned by this couple's serious sugar addiction when they oversee their shopping

programme.title: Secret Britain
programme.desc: The presenters travel across Britain in search of places of natural beauty, this time exploring Devon. Ellie Harrison follows in Drakes footsteps and searches for the area's best kept secrets, while Chris Hollins relives an ancient and long-forgotten purification ritual on Dartmoor. Plus, Denise Lewis uncovers the secret history of the county's most reluctant visitors

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers hit the high street in Salisbury, where they work in pairs to give three retail businesses - a bridal shop, a homeware shop and a lingerie shop - a new lease of life. The designs range from the theatrical, with bold colours and wallpapers, and a cool, contemporary theme, to a safe, colourless look that plays into the hands of an owner who was worried about change. Alan Carr follows their progress, while retail expert Mary Portas joins Michelle Ogundehin to offer her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A compilation edition, featuring finds at Bletchley Park, the Ulster Transport Museum and Crowcombe Court. Plus, Paul Martin uncovers a fascinating family history in Cornwall

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nabil Abdulrashid, Luke Kempner, Sarah Millican and Philippa Perry keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive is in Venice, where he wants to see what it's like to be a local, outnumbered by tourists by more than 200 to one. He starts out by learning the art of the gondolier, and soon learns that steering with just one oar is much more difficult than it looks. He then gets a lesson in glass-blowing and picks peppers on a farm in the Venetian lagoon

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: An interview with Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein, the journalists at the heart of the Watergate scandal, about the fall of Nixon, the presidency of Trump and the state of America and the world today. Amol Rajan questions the pair on some of the most important issues of modern times and explores the parallels between recent events and the scandal that eventually led to the resignation of the 37th US president

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels from Britain's most westerly mainland point to a place once guarded by an ancient Celtic goddess. On the way he discovers how the ancient oak woods of Loch Sunart were once a hive of industry and then goes deep underground to discover how 18th-century miners named a new element. On the shores of Loch Linnhe, he meets the owner of a castle and recreates a scene from Monty Python's Holy Grail

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman who grew up in a Nazi concentration camp as a Jewish orphan longs to know more about her family, and whether any of her relatives escaped the Holocaust. Stacey Dooley also meets Liverpool-born Maureen, who wants to know if her father was actually an African American GI who fell in love with her mother during the Second World War

programme.title: Guilt
programme.desc: Max has a plan to seize Sir Jim Sturrock's money from Maggie Lynch, but he won't tell Jake what it is, leaving his brother close to entering a secret alliance with Sheila. Maggie meets with her estranged daughter Erin and reveals that Max is back in Edinburgh, but she has revelations of her own

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Wolfie and Clarke love their bus - but perhaps not as much as the mysterious Mr Cole and his nieces. The latest in the anthology of darkly comic tales, written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with a guest appearance from Robin Askwith

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Stones and Brian Jones
programme.desc: Nick Broomfield examines the life and legacy of the founder member of the Rolling Stones, looking at the relationships and rivalries within the band in their formative years. Featuring revealing interviews with all the main players and previously unseen archive footage, the film explores the creative musical genius of Jones, key to the success of the band, and uncovers how he was left behind in the shadows of history

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the Vale of Mowbray pork pie factory in Northallerton, Yorkshire, where the traditional pastries have been made since 1928. Gregg finds out which cuts of pork are used and is shown how to make the hot water pastry that acts as a strong 'container' for the pork filling. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey reveals hacks for the perfect vegan short crust pastry and takes to the wheel to learn how to drive one of the HGVs transporting food products around the country every day

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Health consumer show with Dr Xand van Tulleken and journalist Ashley John-Baptiste. The first episode looks at the dangers of health tourism and catching a cold

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the borderlands of Radnorshire, searching for nesting birds along the Wye, dormice and roe deer in its woodlands. He also finds yellowhammers on Offa's Dyke

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell tour a Cornish period house with several old cars hidden in the overgrown back garden. Properties in Co Durham and south Wales about to be sold are also assessed

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, determined to save quality items from being crushed. There's a sliding door sideboard for furniture painter Chloe Kempster and a collection of wooden skis for lighting designer Duncan McKean. Sarah herself gets crafty with a collection of knitted blankets and patches. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill finally has her own garden and can't wait to share her plans and get to grips with bringing this compact space to life. Toby Buckland meets a man who's planted his plot with a wonderful array of fruit and nut trees. And cameras focus on a gardener in Gloucestershire who discusses the 500 pot plants she's designed especially to produce a floral firework display

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the remaining 17 contestants to compete for a possible 10,000 jackpot. Right answers take them closer to the big money, but if at any stage they give an Impossible answer, they will immediately be knocked out. Quiz, hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: In Bristol, flat-sharing undergraduates Dylan, Ben, Roo and Louis seek advice from Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin on improving their diets. Roo is a Coeliac and Ben a vegetarian, so they shop separately and rarely cook or eat together, and expensive tastes and love of brands mean that they're blowing their student loans on pricey pesto and pasta. Plus, Chris goes to Durham to see what the difference between boxed and bottled wine actually is and dietitian Priya Tew discusses plant-based diets and the potential benefits of eating less meat

programme.title: Secret Britain
programme.desc: The team explores Northern Ireland, a place brimming with secrets. Denise Lewis competes in an unusual competition, Chris Hollins goes in search of a witch's lair at the top of a mysterious mountain and Ellie Harrison uncovers the secret history of an army-training base that has been closed to the public for more than a century

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers fly solo this week, giving them a chance to demonstrate their individual abilities as they transform shepherd huts into boutique boltholes on a glampsite in north Wales. The client is a brand-new business so they have a blank canvas to work on, and having been given individual briefs by Michelle Ogundehin, each designer takes a different approach to turning these tiny spaces into luxury living accommodation, with the challenge of an en-suite shower room and an outdoor space thrown in for good measure. What will Michelle and guest judge Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen make of the end results?

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts touch down at Bletchley Park, the Ulster Transport Museum and Crowcombe Court to track down some unusual items to sell at auction. They uncover a beautiful watercolour and some stunning porcelain. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits Antony in Cornwall to unearth a fascinating family history

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nabil Abdulrashid, Luke Kempner, Sarah Millican and Philippa Perry take part in the final challenges before the winner is announced by Richard Osman

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the Conegliano region in the foothills of the Alps, to find out about the production of his favourite tipple Prosecco. One of the country's few female female wine-makers explains about the grapes they use - and when the importance of the harvest - before inviting him to spend the night in a giant wine barrel. Moving on, vintage car fan Clive joins the 100 Miglia rally and hunts for antiques in the hilltop town of Asolo

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson discovers how the Cornish village of Botallack was the centre of the Cornish tin and copper mining industry and supplied a deadly poison to the world. Local resident Paula Nicholls explains how her ancestors, the Boyne family, owned a mine which was involved in a catastrophic explosion in 1893 where 20 men tragically died

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson and Lizzie Schofield present a follow-up on how the dahlia tubers planted in pots in April are coming on and show how to take dahlia cuttings. Kirsty also sows a bed around the viburnum that was moved last autumn, an area that will be particularly good for pollinators. Plus, the start of a project for a family whose newbuild house needs a garden

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tropical gingers and tomatoes and direct sowing beans, and Rekha Mistry's shares the secrets of her success for growing aubergines on her London allotment. Elsewhere, Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, designed and planted by owners who love to recycle and repurpose as much as they can, and journalist Rosie Kinchen discusses how horticulture helped her deal with postnatal depression

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of two historic homes in the south of England. The National Trust work to preserve the gardens of Sissinghurst Castle in Kent in the same style that previous owner Vita Sackville-West planted them back in the 1930s. Twelve miles away, the Jacobean manor Bateman's was the sanctuary of Rudyard Kipling until his death in 1936. The plan is to preserve his personal possessions to tell not just the story of Kipling the author, but also the man and father

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy and Lance become eco-warriors when they discover that their beloved oak tree is due to be felled. However, a 24 hour helpline turns out to be more of a hindrance. Later, Andy stumbles upon treasure when, for once, he wasn't even looking for it. Comedy drama, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: Documentary about the attack on the 2017 Route 91 Harvest music festival in Las Vegas that left 60 dead and hundreds injured, using first-hand accounts and never-before-seen footage to chart the events. The first instalment reveals how 22,000 fans were at the celebration of country music when the gunfire started as headliner Jason Aldean opened his first set, and amid the confusion, groups of friends and families try to flee but get separated

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: A look at how a deluge of 911 calls caused concern that multiple shooters were on the Las Vegas strip, while a police officer dragged his bleeding partner to safety. Between bursts of automatic gunfire, concert-goers made a run for it if they could, while SWAT officers converged on the Mandalay Bay Hotel, where had information that the shooter was on the 32nd floor

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: There has been a sharp increase in the number of adults who think they have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. The NHS has been overwhelmed, and thousands are turning to private clinics for assessment instead. Rory Carson poses as a patient to reveal some clinics charging large fees for a short online consultation, and evidence suggesting diagnoses are being handed out to almost everyone who books an appointment. The programme also reveals clinics prescribing powerful drugs without carrying out proper checks

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work alone to transform hair salons in Bristol. With each salon giving a different brief, a budget of 3,000 and just two days to complete the makeover, the designers have their work cut out for them in the semi-final. Monika embraces her gothic maximalist signature style to renovate her classic salon with a unique charm and starts with a black paint job. Tom has the challenge of modernising an industrial salon and giving a fresh edge to the rugged and characterful interior. The owners of a high-end salon that aims to deliver a luxury experience asked Jack for a Scandi makeover but he decides to take it one step further with a style he calls 'Japandi'

programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Joel goes behind the scenes at the Harry Potter and the Cursed Child stage show, while Stephen Mulhern is in the studio to show some magic of his own

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall finds out which predators have the best weapons, looking at the adder, the diamond rattlesnake, the crocodile and the barn owl

programme.title: Newsies: The Broadway Musical (2017)
programme.desc: A performance of the musical filmed at the Pantages Theatre in Hollywood, California. Set in New York City at the turn of the 20th century, the story follows Jack Kelly, a charismatic newsboy and leader of a ragged band of teenage 'newsies', who dream of a better life far from the hardship of the streets. Starring original Broadway cast members Jeremy Jordan, Kara Lindsay and Ben Fankhauser

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks present as the Butlands from Cornwall, the Lees from Warrington, the Gohil and Al-Sheikhs from London and the Whites from Selkirk each feed a family of four for 10 using ingredients from the freezer

programme.title: Great Expectations (1946)
programme.desc: An orphan falls in love with the cold-hearted adopted daughter of an eccentric old woman. A mysterious benefactor gives him the chance to rise through London's high society, but in the process he forgets his humble roots and is not prepared for the truth about the girl he loves and the stranger funding his new life. Drama, based on Charles Dickens' novel, starring John Mills, Jean Simmons, Finlay Currie and Alec Guinness

programme.title: The Remains of the Day (1993)
programme.desc: A butler in a 1930s aristocratic household has dedicated himself to serving his master, putting duty above all else and repressing his affection for the housekeeper, who also happens to be in love with him. On the outbreak of war, the nobleman's Nazi sympathies come to light, marking a change of heart in the old servant, who looks back with misgivings about the loyalty that may have cost him dearly. Period drama, with Anthony Hopkins, Emma Thompson and James Fox

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey head to Dartmoor, where items of interest include a platinum disc awarded for Coldplay's 2005 album X&Y, which is signed by the band's members. Plus, an expert in America talks about a walking stick that is associated with General Tom Thumb

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring puts the defence of the realm before personal pride, resulting in him nearly losing command of the platoon. Classic comedy with the Home Guard, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of two historic homes in the south of England. The National Trust work to preserve the gardens of Sissinghurst Castle in Kent in the same style that previous owner Vita Sackville-West planted them back in the 1930s. Twelve miles away, the Jacobean manor Bateman's was the sanctuary of Rudyard Kipling until his death in 1936. The plan is to preserve his personal possessions to tell not just the story of Kipling the author, but also the man and father

programme.title: Pet Shop Boys at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe's many appearances on the BBC, from the early days of just two men and a synth right up to the fun and flamboyance of their modern live shows. The programme also features collaborations with Liza Minnelli (Losing My Mind), Dusty Springfield (What Have I Done to Deserve This?) and David Bowie (Hallo Spaceboy)

programme.title: Reel Stories: Pet Shop Boys
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary invites Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe to join him in a London cinema and reflect on some of the pivotal moments from their career to date through clips shown on screen

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools returns to London's Alexandra Palace Theatre for another run of his music show, with the opening edition featuring performances by Irish singer-songwriter Hozier and 2021 Mercury Prize-winner Arlo Parks. Making their debuts on the programme are Irish folk musician Lisa O'Neill, San Diego trio Thee Sacred Souls and Kent singer Venbee. Jools also chat to music photographer Jill Furmanovsky about an exhibition of her work being held at the Manchester Central Library

programme.title: Radio 2 Live in Hyde Park
programme.desc: The duo's headline set at the Radio 2 festival in 2019, featuring performances of Always On My Mind, It's a Sin, Suburbia, Left to My Own Devices and West End Girls

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: A look back at the year that arguably marked the peak of new British pop as Wham!, ABC and Culture Club all made appearances. Dexys Midnight Runners' new Irish sound topped the summer charts for four weeks with Come on Eileen and their follow-up, Jackie Wilson Says, led to a notorious moment in TOTP history. It was also the year that Shalamar's Jeffrey Daniel introduced the moonwalk to British TV

programme.title: By the Grace of God (2018)
programme.desc: Three men who were all abused as children by the same Catholic priest work together to dismantle the code of silence that continues to protect their abuser decades on. Drama, starring Melvil Poupaud and Denis Mnochet. In French

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team explores the threat of an asteroid impact on earth and meet space scientists who are developing methods of planetary defence that sound like the stuff of science fiction. Maggie meets Professor Alan Fitzsimmons, expert in asteroid observation, to learn how the latest technology monitors near-Earth asteroids. He explains which ones are a current concern, and why we missed the dangerous Chelyabinsk meteor - a 9,000-ton fireball that exploded in the sky above Russia

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines how the railways stimulated great changes to the nation's economy, and encouraged a new generation of mechanical engineers, skilled workers, managers and accountants. Originally, local entrepreneurs viewed trains as vehicles for shifting raw materials, stock and goods, however it soon became clear that there was money to be made in transporting people

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum

programme.title: Tea with Mussolini (1999)
programme.desc: Eccentric English and American women living in Florence during the tense pre-war years of the 1930s experience the ups and downs of parenthood when they collectively adopt a local boy disowned by his father. However, as international hostilities break out, their happy existence comes under threat. Period comedy drama, starring Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Joan Plowright, Cher, Lily Tomlin and Baird Wallace

programme.title: Summer Holiday (1963)
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway causes a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic examines techniques and conventions within a genre that mixes film and music and encompasses many forms, from drama and comedy to fantasy and documentary. There is the classic pop star vehicle, where the biggest acts play themselves, or a version of themselves, as well as dramatised accounts of the stars' lives that dazzle with musical set pieces, while playing on the fascination with the darker side of fame

programme.title: Paul Merson: A Walk Through My Life
programme.desc: The football pundit and former Arsenal and England midfielder walks through North Yorkshire, reflecting on his life, career and faith. Carrying a 360-degree camera, he also describes his struggles with drink and gambling addiction

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum

programme.title: Viva La Diva: The Queens of Pop
programme.desc: Ana Matronic explores the key elements that have shaped the identities and sounds of Beyonc, Cher, Grace Jones, Madonna and Mariah Carey, investigating the lives and legacies of these five pop superstars. The Scissor Sisters singer unpicks their triumphs and tragedies to get a better understanding of what makes them so special, before setting out what a diva might look like in the future

programme.title: Grace Jones: Bloodlight and Bami (2017)
programme.desc: Documentary profile of the singer, following her in the recording studio, backstage and at home with her extended family in Jamaica, interspersed with concert footage of hits including Pull Up to the Bumper and Slave to the Rhythm

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Following his adventures at Everest Base Camp, the intrepid traveller leaves the mountains behind and moves on to Tibet. Here he discovers that, while there may be an increasing Chinese influence, religion is once again being tolerated. He visits the Potala Palace, the spectacular monasteries of Tashilunpo and takes a dip in a hot spring. From there he continues his journey with a family of nomads heading to a summer horse festival in Yushu

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The adventurer travels along the Yangtze river into China, where he meets Mosuo singer Namu, who explains the region's traditional walking marriage ceremonies. He continues into India to marvel at one of Assam's great tea estates, makes the acquaintance of the local elephants and stays at a monastery where the monks introduce him to their unique dancing style

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Cheerful mother of three Ester is about to turn 40 and planning to celebrate the big birthday with all her friends and family. But the day before the party, she receives a phone call that turns her life upside down. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard. In Norwegian

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Ester insists on one last magical night out with her closest friends before the cancer treatment begins. But unbeknown to all of them, Charlotte makes an unsettling discovery. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard and Sara Khorami. In Norwegian

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Historian Dan Snow explores the discovery, excavation and raising of the ship, finding out what the latest research has revealed about the vessel and her crew. The presenter also investigates how the project helped create modern underwater archaeology, and examines the techniques, challenges and successes of the divers and archaeologists involved

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc: With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. The first of two documentaries offers a unique opportunity to see the very best bits of Victoria's work that she loved the most, drawing on some of the 20 sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors including Russell T Davies, Ken Loach, Winsome Pinnock, Jane Wymark and Joan Armatrading discuss Victoria's broad catalogue of award-winning comedy. Narrated by Sara Pascoe

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List

Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovannas bag are colourful sheets of sandpaper, and all the parents and little ones have different objects and toys that feel rough. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding a safe, baby-appropriate rough object or toy inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The nursery rhyme Michael Finnegan features, as does a story involving Baby Bear and Baby Tiger, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring rough things too. programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The Go Jetters are going to Westman Islands, Iceland, where the world's largest colony of Atlantic puffins gathers every year. Lars loves these tough little birds and explains how, although they spend most of their lives flying out to sea and fishing, they return to land each year to lay their eggs. When the baby birds, also called pufflings, eventually hatch, they fly out towards the ocean. But the light from nearby towns often confuses them about where to go, leading local children and adults to form 'puffin patrols' to rescue the pufflings. Lars is excited to help out but is upset when he discovers Glitch, also a fan of puffins, is already well-known on the islands for his skills as a puffin rescuer. Although Glitch offers him a place in his puffin patrol, Lars is determined to outdo Glitch with a patrol of his own - but when he recruits a clumsy Grimbot, things take a turn for the worse...

However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of the former Wales goalkeeper, following his unconventional rise to the top of professional football, and the events that shaped him into an icon. programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the woman whose credit rating was ruined after scammers took out multiple mobile phone contracts in her name. She only found out when she tried to apply for a mortgage

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators search for a roofer who conned people out of more than half a million pounds, and a fraudster who lied to get a job as a Captain with one of the UK's largest airlines

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Newbury Antiques and Collectors Fair in Berkshire, where experts Charles Hanson and David Harper help two teams acquire items of value to take to auction. The host also pops across to Bristol to meet the maker of cigar box guitars

programme.title: Scottish First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Kirsten Campbell introduces First Minister's Questions from the Scottish Parliament

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob cooks up a storm, while Zara gets to grips with her new role. Bear meets an old college friend with big ambitions

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, determined to save quality items from being crushed. There's a sliding door sideboard for furniture painter Chloe Kempster and a collection of wooden skis for lighting designer Duncan McKean. Sarah herself gets crafty with a collection of knitted blankets and patches. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman returns to her Kent roots to help a young family currently in London find a new home. Away from the house hunt, Nicki takes a trip down memory lane, meeting up with her best friend from school, before they join Nicki's mother at the family's beach hut in Herne Bay

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents the programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items brought in by members of the public, including a toy cafeteria truck, a surprising key, and Victorian Children's clogs

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: DCI Shaw confronts Lou about her tattoo, forcing her to lie about her relationship with Denise. Meanwhile, Stevie has a business idea that could also keep the peace between Scarlett and Callum, and Maggie has to decide if her new business is worth jeopardising her personal relationships.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay breaks Lola out of hospital for a fun-filled day at the seaside but it quickly goes south as the pair get in trouble with the police after Lola steals a necklace to give to Lexi for her 16th birthday

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second group of seven hopefuls compete for the chance to work in a professional kitchen for the first time. They must cook a dish they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or feature in their cookbook. With Gregg unwell, Monica Galetti joins John Torode to decide which two will be going home, after which the remaining five work in the Royal Opera House's Piazza restaurant, under the guidance of executive chef Richard Robinson. But only the best will make it through to the semi-final

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The semi-finalists have their social media skills tested as they are challenged to sell a local street food brand online, under the watchful eye of TikTok sensation Uncle Roger. Next, Gordon tasks the contestants to devise a recipe to appear on the front page of Waitrose's in-house magazine, before presenting their creations in front of undercover experts including world-renowned food photographer, Mary McCartney. Who will impress Gordon and make it to the final?

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Fort William in the Highlands. On her panel are Scottish Government Cabinet Secretary for Net Zero Miri McAllan MSP, Conservative peer and Scotland Minister Malcolm Offord, Labour's Deputy Leader in Scotland Jackie Baillie MSP, the former First Minister of Scotland and Alba Party leader Alex Salmond and the journalist Nina Myskow

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a family whose once-loved home is now a wrecked shell, after an insurance claim made six years ago went disastrously wrong. Plus, the programme revisits a pledge made in 2018 by then-local government minister Rishi Sunak to keep private parking companies in check

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: An incident in which a train driver suffered facial injuries after a brick was hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train was travelling at 70mph, but the driver managed to bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries. Rav Wilding reports on how attacks like this have prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology, aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Officers work to bring a bogus coach company to justice after leaving hundreds of pensions stranded in Torquay, and also track down a loan shark targeting hard-up families

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell tour a Cornish period house with several old cars hidden in the overgrown back garden. Properties in Co Durham and south Wales about to be sold are also assessed

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the contest from Leominster in Herefordshire, with Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell as expert advisors. Eric also visits Hereford Cathedral's 17th-century library where the books are kept under lock and key

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Finn is away receiving treatment for his PTSD, so Concepta takes his place on a fishing trip with Shay and Barry. Their pleasure cruise goes horribly wrong, however, when the engine of their boat explodes, leaving one of the crew seriously injured

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne calls on help to exercise creative flair to an outdated armchair, while blacksmiths Bex and Dave are tasked with turning old scaffolding props into something special

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple to find a new home in Dorset on a budget of 550,000, and creates sustainable beauty products made from locally foraged plants and herbs

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as the dealers bid to buy a brass and copper antique diving helmet, a growling Steiff bear, a Basil Brush ride-on toy, a pair of scales and an old mangle

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Silversmith Brenton West repairs a boxing trophy won by an accomplished sportsman and much-loved grandfather. Larry Gaines fought professionally from 1923 and refused to let prejudice hamper his career. He was the first black boxer to fight in the Royal Albert Hall and his family is immensely proud of him. Also being restored are a pair of old football boots and a vintage globe. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England cricketer Tammy Beaumont, rugby league great Robbie Hunter-Paul, double Paralympic gold medallist Maisie Summers-Newton and former Bolton Wanderers footballer Fabrice Muamba join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits six siblings working together to futureproof their family farm in Dunbartonshire, while Cammy Wilson meets a young farmer who has diversified into deer. Arlene Stuart is in Kilmartin Glen in Argyll to shine a light on the earliest prehistoric animal carvings discovered in Scotland

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace bring knockout week to an end by challenging the 10 remaining cooks to serve up a dish that they can eat with their hands. The stakes are high because two of the hopefuls will be going home, leaving the other eight to move on to semi-final week

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts, as comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Dom and Kay struggle to meet the Brightmarsh Gang's payment deadline, so she comes up with a devious plan involving Youth Pastor Tomi's church fund to try and get the cash together for the pay off. Kay is adamant this money cannot be touched, but will Dom be able to persuade him to take it? Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome star guests and members of the public to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between, joined in this edition by father-and-son combo Michael and Jack Whitehall. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: It's a new start for Oly and Santi, with Jacinda starting kindy at Oly's old primary school. The grind of unexpected early parenthood has taken its toll, and they are separated and coparenting. Later, unexpected news spins Oly off her axis. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Santi reconsiders introducing Jacinda to his new girlfriend Keeks after she and Oly have intense reactions, while Vince and Angie navigate the consequences of being 'too nice'. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

John Hughes' sci-fi comedy, starring Kelly LeBrock, Anthony Michael Hall, Ilan Mitchell-Smith, Robert Downey Jr and Bill Paxton

Plus, a revisit to a church in Dover that Martin Roberts first saw five years ago

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the contest from Leominster in Herefordshire, with Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell as expert advisors. Eric also visits Hereford Cathedral's 17th-century library where the books are kept under lock and key

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Finn is away receiving treatment for his PTSD, so Concepta takes his place on a fishing trip with Shay and Barry. Their pleasure cruise goes horribly wrong, however, when the engine of their boat explodes, leaving one of the crew seriously injured

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne calls on help to exercise creative flair to an outdated armchair, while blacksmiths Bex and Dave are tasked with turning old scaffolding props into something special

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor scammers' phone calls, to try and stop the victims losing out to real-time scams. It's then a race against the criminals to contact the victim and intercept the scam before any money is handed over to the crooks. The show also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.title: Election 2023
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers, Tara Mills and Mark Simpson present live coverage of the local election results, with reports from all 11 councils. Plus, analysis and reaction in the studio with a range of experts, commentators and politicians

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Silversmith Brenton West repairs a boxing trophy won by an accomplished sportsman and much-loved grandfather. Larry Gaines fought professionally from 1923 and refused to let prejudice hamper his career. He was the first black boxer to fight in the Royal Albert Hall and his family is immensely proud of him. Also being restored are a pair of old football boots and a vintage globe. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: Top chefs help the host control his weight, by revealing the secret of cooking healthy, low-calorie, yet delicious food. Stephen also meets other people in his same boat, starting with Dora, who is the heaviest she has ever been. She believes her appetite for sweet sugary treats is now out of control as the duo share stories as to how they have lost their way with food. He then invites her to join him in the kitchen of Michelin star holder Alex Greene, who prepares some low-calorie delights that prompt an unexpected reaction from Stephen

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England cricketer Tammy Beaumont, rugby league great Robbie Hunter-Paul, double Paralympic gold medallist Maisie Summers-Newton and former Bolton Wanderers footballer Fabrice Muamba join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace bring knockout week to an end by challenging the 10 remaining cooks to serve up a dish that they can eat with their hands. The stakes are high because two of the hopefuls will be going home, leaving the other eight to move on to semi-final week

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts, as comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Dom and Kay struggle to meet the Brightmarsh Gang's payment deadline, so she comes up with a devious plan involving Youth Pastor Tomi's church fund to try and get the cash together for the pay off. Kay is adamant this money cannot be touched, but will Dom be able to persuade him to take it? Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The married couple welcome star guests and members of the public to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and absolutely everything in-between, joined in this edition by father-and-son combo Michael and Jack Whitehall. Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: It's a new start for Oly and Santi, with Jacinda starting kindy at Oly's old primary school. The grind of unexpected early parenthood has taken its toll, and they are separated and coparenting. Later, unexpected news spins Oly off her axis. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Santi reconsiders introducing Jacinda to his new girlfriend Keeks after she and Oly have intense reactions, while Vince and Angie navigate the consequences of being 'too nice'. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Weird Science (1985)
programme.desc: Two sexually frustrated teenagers use their computer to design the perfect woman, but are ill prepared for the outcome when their creation comes to life. She decides to make men of them, by putting them in a series of situations that will force them to stand up for themselves. John Hughes' sci-fi comedy, starring Kelly LeBrock, Anthony Michael Hall, Ilan Mitchell-Smith, Robert Downey Jr and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers, Tara Mills and Mark Simpson present live coverage of the local election results, with reports from all 11 councils, plus analysis and reaction in the studio with a range of experts, commentators and politicians

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts from Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, where experts Tim Weeks and Charles Hanson assist the reds and blues as they vie, hoping to make the greater profit at auction. Away from the contest, Charlie learns about one of the bravest British heroines of the 20th century

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Leeds Rhinos v Wigan Warriors (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Headingley Stadium. Wigan lifted the trophy last season, defeating Huddersfield Giants 16-14 in the final, while Leeds were eliminated at home to Castleford Tigers at this stage, but will be expecting to an improved performance this time around as they look to emulate their last triumph in the competition in 2020

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and brothers David and Harry Rich take on the job of redesigning an unusually shaped garden in Droitwich Spa, Worcestershire. Lionel loves firing up the BBQ to cook for the family, but he and wife Paulette also want a tranquil space to relax in. Can the designers come up with a zoned plot with plenty of screening that ticks all the boxes?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. In each episode, contestants are guided by a host of celebrity experts, with tonight's advice coming from Anton Du Beke, Josie Gibson, Iain Stirling, Kadeena Cox, Nigel Ng, Tony Blackburn and Emma Barnett

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are Sally Lindsay, Andi Oliver, Chris McCausland, Jimmy Carr, Sophie Ellis-Bextor and Melvin Odoom

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Phil Tufnell, Mark Butcher, Cece Lightfoot, Pooja Shah, Chris McCausland, Sarah Keyworth, Ritchie Neville and Scott Robinson try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jodie's drink is spiked during a night out, but she is able to call Rida for help. When she makes it to the emergency department, Faith offers her support, but a furious Max assumes she is drunk. Ryan feels he is not being given enough opportunity to prove his worth, while Teddy worries about asking Paige out

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker as DI Annika Strandhed, who has returned to Glasgow to head up the Marine Homicide Unit, where she is tasked with solving puzzling crimes and unexplained murders that wash up in Scotland's waters. On her first day in a new role, Annika is called in to solve the murder of a man found in the Clyde, with a harpoon piercing his head

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Bournemouth v Manchester United at Vitality Stadium and Nottingham Forest v Arsenal at The City Ground and Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield, as valuable points were up for grabs at both ends of the table. Plus, Tottenham Hotspur v Brentford, Fulham v Crystal Palace and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Everton

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards count down those Premier League players most adept at using sly tactics to gain an advantage

programme.title: The Mercy (2017)
programme.desc: The story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe in 1968. The struggles he confronted on the controversial voyage, while his family awaited his return, is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times. Factual drama, starring Colin Firth, David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: The Interview
programme.desc: In a wide-ranging interview, the BBC's Yalda Hakim sits down with Bangladesh prime minister and the world's longest-serving female head of government, Sheikh Hasina, to discuss next year's general elections, Bangladesh's human rights record and the plight of the minority Rohingya refugees now living in Bangladesh

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Dress to Impress

programme.desc: A land dispute escalates during a cowboy fair run by the Wild West Society in the village of Ford Florey. Farmers Jack Fincher and Silas Burbage both claim to own a patch of wasteland known as the Swamp, but Dan Malko wants to buy it and create a travellers' site. Barnaby and Jones are called in when the feud leads to murder during the Wild West-style shoot-outs at the annual event. Guest starring Kenneth Cranham, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the man's death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a music masterclass led by a renowned pianist, a shy prodigy suffers a panic attack and runs off to a nearby river. To her horror, she witnesses a woman drowning and a baby left on the riverbank. But when Barnaby arrives, there is no sign of the victim - and he is struck by similarities to another mysterious case that happened 20 years ago at the same spot. Guest starring veteran actor James Fox and Coronation Street's Ian Puleston-Davies (Owen Armstrong), alongside former Corrie star Richard Fleeshman (Craig Harris)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot

However, Poirot is soon on the scent of troubled heiress Norma Restarick, who had problems of her own - not least confessing to the possibility she has killed someone herself. Guest starring Jemima Rooper, Zoe Wanamaker and Peter Bowles, with David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth

programme.desc: In a retrospective episode set immediately after the events of series two, Rachel faces further accusations of masterminding the fatal attack on ex-lover Nick and finds comfort in the arms of ever-faithful Sean, agreeing to marry him. programme.title: The Great British Treasure Hunt

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

programme.title: The Great British Treasure Hunt
programme.desc: Henry Cole takes five teams of intrepid metal detectorists to Somerleyton in Suffolk for round three of the series. As the teams compete to be crowned detectorists of the year, they unearth rare artefacts and ancient coins

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

programme.desc: A look back at some of the most memorable staff and patient stories filmed since 2011 at King's College Hospital and St George's in south London - places where life, love and loss unfold every day. At St George's, 22-month-old Daisy arrives by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse. She has a fractured skull, a bruise on her brain and concussion. As surgeons plan their next move, Maggie, an 83-year-old with a lust for life, has suspected sepsis, and five-year-old Roman has a pencil lead stuck in his ear. At the tiny village of La Vajol, where many refugees headed to cross the border into France, Michael meets Margaret, some of whose family escaped through here

programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the sitcom, revealing how the show's creators had to fight the BBC throughout its run to keep it on air, how there was the off-screen jostling for top billing, and the personal tragedies that befell the cast. Featuring contributions from actor and comedian John Thomson, stars Mike Berry and Louise Burton, singer Jess Conrad (who appeared on the show), Mollie Sugden's son Robin Moore and original crew members Robin Carr and Roy Gould
