Julian examines a herd of cows from a breed that is on the endangered species list, a young alpaca has been unable to stand or walk since birth, and a dog lover is left distraught when one of his four-legged friends brutally attacks another

programme.title: Witches: A Century of Murder
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb's investigation into the notorious 17th-century witch trials concludes with a profile of Matthew Hopkins, the opportunistic puritan witch-hunter who transformed paranoia about Satanism into a lucrative business as he hanged hundreds of people for crimes they could not possibly have committed. Making use of contemporary reports, Suzannah paints a portrait of a man who believed he could cross any boundary and break any law to achieve his goals. Naming himself 'Witchfinder General', Hopkins toured the country charging fees for his services, but Suzannah's research reveals that ultimately, the public's distaste for witches was not as strong as its hatred of being conned by charlatans. Hopkins would eventually die of tuberculosis in relative obscurity, but his malign legacy lived on across the Atlantic, as witch-hunts began in Salem, Massachusetts

programme.desc: As proud grandparents, King Charles and Queen Camilla have 10 grandchildren between them, with some being princes and princesses while others have more normal existences outside the media spotlight. Bruce Jones opens-up about how he struggled to find work after being typecast as Les Battersby in Coronation Street, while Hollyoaks' Kieron Richardson talks about how a slip-of-the-tongue regarding a plot twist left fans open-mouthed

programme.desc: After being framed for murder and narrowly escaping the town mob, Jim Guthrie returns three years later to find the real killer. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Dianne Foster and Donna Reed

programme.title: Comanche Station (1960)
programme.desc: A cowboy recruits a trio of outlaws to rescue a woman held captive at a Comanche camp and reunite her with her husband in return for a large reward. However, his partners decide the bounty should be split three ways rather than four and plan to double-cross him. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins and Skip Homeier

programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielberg's fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance

programme.title: The Book of Eli (2010)
programme.desc: A man travels across a post-apocalyptic America carrying a book believed to hold the key to mankind's future. He encounters trouble in a desolate town and finds himself pursued by a despotic leader who will stop at nothing to get his hands on the text. Action adventure, starring Denzel Washington, Gary Oldman, Mila Kunis, Ray Stevenson and Jennifer Beals

programme.title: Death Proof (2007)
programme.desc: A psychopathic stalker uses his specially modified car to hunt down and kill women. Several months after targeting a cluster of victims in Texas, the driver resurfaces in Tennessee, where he sets his sights on a group of female friends. However, the headstrong girls turn the tables on the murderer. Quentin Tarantino's thriller, starring Kurt Russell, Rosario Dawson, Zoe Bell and Rose McGowan

programme.title: Barking Dogs Never Bite (2000)
programme.desc: A maintenance worker motivated by a desire to become famous decides to investigate the mysterious demise of several dogs. Parasite director Bong Joon-ho's dark comedy, starring Lee Sung-jae and Park Hyun-nam. In Korean with English subtitles

programme.title: Tobruk (1967)
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell

programme.title: Men in Black 3 Interview Special
programme.desc: Will Smith discusses returning to the role of Agent J for the third film in the sci-fi comedy series, and director Barry Sonnenfeld speaks about his role behind the camera on the three movies. Newcomer Josh Brolin shares his thoughts on filling Tommy Lee Jones' shoes as a younger version of veteran alien-catcher Agent K

programme.title: The Quiet Man (1952)
programme.desc: An American prizefighter retires after killing an opponent in the ring, and returns to his Irish roots in a village in Galway, where he falls for a local woman. Unfortunately, their romance is hampered by a conflict with her brother over a property matter. John Ford's Oscar-winning romantic comedy drama, starring John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Victor McLaglen, Barry Fitzgerald and Ward Bond

programme.title: Alien Covenant Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Ridley Scott and stars Michael Fassbender and Katherine Waterston talk about their sci-fi, horror sequel, Alien Covenant

programme.title: To Hell and Back (1955)
programme.desc: Biopic of actor Audie Murphy, following his service in the Second World War. Enlisting in the Army as a teenager to support his younger siblings, he excelled himself in action in the conflict in Europe and became one of America's most decorated soldiers. Starring Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson, Charles Drake and Gregg Palmer

programme.title: Men in Black 3 Interview Special
programme.desc: Will Smith discusses returning to the role of Agent J for the third film in the sci-fi comedy series, and director Barry Sonnenfeld speaks about his role behind the camera on the three movies. Newcomer Josh Brolin shares his thoughts on filling Tommy Lee Jones' shoes as a younger version of veteran alien-catcher Agent K

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

programme.title: Hereditary (2018)
programme.desc: After the death of her mother, artist Annie and her family all mourn her loss in different ways. Annie and her daughter flirt with the supernatural which leads to each having disturbing and worrying encounters with a sinister force. Horror mystery, starring Toni Collette, Milly Shapiro, Gabriel Byrne, Alex Wolff and Christy Summerhays

programme.title: 48 Hrs (1982)
programme.desc: A hard-bitten cop goes on the trail of two escaped fugitives who killed several of his fellow officers. He needs someone with inside knowledge of the criminals, and is reluctantly forced to temporarily release a fast-talking thief from prison to help him in his investigation. Comedy thriller, starring Nick Nolte, Eddie Murphy and Annette O'Toole

programme.title: Escape from New York (1981)
programme.desc: Former special forces soldier Snake Plissken is sentenced to life on Manhattan Island, an anarchic penal colony for the most dangerous criminals. When Air Force One is hijacked and crashes there, Snake is coerced into rescuing the US president from prisoners holding him hostage. John Carpenter's sci-fi action adventure, with Kurt Russell, Donald Pleasence, Lee Van Cleef, Adrienne Barbeau and Isaac Hayes

programme.title: Barnyard (2006)
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Tooth Fairy (2010)
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2014)
programme.desc: A reporter discovers four humanoid amphibians who live in the sewers of New York, and use their martial arts skills to fight crime. Fantasy adventure, starring Megan Fox and William Fichtner, with the voice of Johnny Knoxville

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016)

Assisted by two mutant henchman, Shredder goes in search of a lost device that will allow his new ally to mount an invasion of Earth. Action adventure sequel, starring Megan Fox, Will Arnett and Stephen Amell

programme.title: Daddy's Home (2015)

His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: Upgrade (2018)
programme.desc: Technophobe Grey Trace is left confined to a wheelchair after being mugged. His only hope for revenge is Stem, an experimental computer chip implant that allows him to control his body. However, once implanted, Stem starts talking to Trace and takes over his body. Sci-fi thriller, starring Logan Marshall-Green and Melanie Vallejo

programme.title: Dune (1984)
programme.desc: A far-flung galactic empire is sustained by a priceless mind-expanding spice found only on a desolate desert world. Rival factions seeking to take over production plunge the planet into war, while the native people await the coming of a prophesied saviour who will lead them to freedom. David Lynch's sci-fi fantasy based on Frank Herbert's novel, starring Kyle MacLachlan, Francesca Annis, Sting, Patrick Stewart and Kenneth McMillan

programme.title: The Columnist (2019)
programme.desc: Successful columnist Femke is flooded every day by anonymous harassments and death threats on social media. She becomes addicted to the vicious messages, and finds herself continuously clicking back to the hateful comments before she goes to sleep. Not only is this affecting her motivation to write new articles, but she also needs to finish writing the novel she promised to deliver her publisher. One day, she snaps - but the act of violence and revenge inspires her to write like never before. Comic thriller, starring Katja Herbers. In Dutch

programme.desc: Sheldon and Leonard invent excuses to avoid having to attend Penny's performance in a production of the stage musical Rent, but maintaining the pretence makes matters increasingly complicated. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with DJ Qualls

Comedy, starring Joe Lo Truglio and Jason Mantzoukas

programme.desc: Boyle organises an elaborate scavenger hunt for Peralta's bachelor party, but the guys take some short cuts that throw the event into disarray. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon uses his holidays to help Amy in her biology lab, but moans about the menial jobs he is given - until she asks him to dissect a brain. Penny grows curious about Leonard's attitude to marriage when Bernadette asks Howard to sign a pre-nuptial agreement

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard devise a contest to decide whether Sheldon or Kripke should get Professor Rothman's vacant corner office. Meanwhile, Penny receives the gift of a painting from Amy to celebrate their friendship, but discreetly tries to dispose of it with help from Bernadette

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is dejected to see Penny with another man and decides to cut his losses by going back to fellow scientist Leslie Winkle - a move that upsets Sheldon. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Sara Gilbert

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian. As her obsession intensifies, she begins to neglect her friends and seeks the company of the usually snide Sheldon, whom she continually pesters for advice. Starring Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire try to squeeze in some time alone, while Mitch and Cam make a big decision. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant

programme.desc: The detectives search for the relatives of a well-liked Essex woman without knowing the value of her estate, and hope that their gamble will pay off when the amount is revealed . programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search is on for relatives of a Korean War veteran who died in London, and as the case progresses the team is able to help someone meet family members she did not know she had. programme.title: Four in a Bed

Steve and Lisa Tindall seem impressed, but Jennifer and Diana Carnegie question the high price tag

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Steve and Lisa Tindall, who own the King's Head Inn in Rye, East Sussex, where they hope their guests will fall for their boutique B&B. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former breakfast TV presenter Matt Arnold welcomes the contestants to The Bridge Hotel Brandon in Suffolk, and hopes that his mantra of 'beautiful beds, blissful bathrooms and brilliant breakfasts' shines through. The group takes part in a rowing competition in the afternoon, but delays at breakfast and a runny egg cause irritation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid and confront their critics, and things get heated when it's time to count up the cash

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY

Wishing he had a head for heights, Lee has to face his fears in order to get their event space up and running again. Gloucestershire couple Jayne and Steve race to renovate the ground floor ahead of their official B&B opening. As they restore the entrance hall's 130-year-old mosaic floor and repair the salon's panels, a wallpaper mural really puts them to the test

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of teacher Michele Long and architect Michael Howe, who want to restore and transform a 100-year-old blacksmiths in Co Antrim. With virtually no practical experience, Michael wants to do as much of the project as possible by himself. However, the weather on the coastline is fierce, and the freezing weather coupled with a tight budget of 150k means the build is stretched from one to three years

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Across Britain, more than 600,000 buildings lie unused and unloved, and nearly a third of them are commercial. Architect George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into these properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for 50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Moped delivery man Hussnain, 24, is rushed to A&E after being caught up in an accident involving a police car chasing another vehicle. Seventy-six-year-old Edward is brought in due to his breathing difficulties and a serious pre-existing heart condition, while part-time wrestlers Kieran and James come in after Kieran injures his knee in a bout

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A head-on car accident in Cumbria leaves Nick's life hanging in the balance, East Anglian heli-meds land on a roundabout island to help Craig who has come off his motorbike and smashed headfirst into a signpost. Plus, medics battle extreme weather conditions to reach a man trapped under his JCB digger

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: Dramatic calls made to emergency operators, including a report of an escaped tiger and a school book-keeper who had to talk down a heavily armed man. Also, a distressing call taken by emergency call handlers after a young woman found her flatmate murdered in their Gateshead home

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Sean Lock face off once again in another unpredictable battle of words and numbers, with help from Kevin Bridges and Rebecca Front. Rachel Riley is on maths-and-letters duty, and Joe Lycett is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Moped delivery man Hussnain, 24, is rushed to A&E after being caught up in an accident involving a police car chasing another vehicle. Seventy-six-year-old Edward is brought in due to his breathing difficulties and a serious pre-existing heart condition, while part-time wrestlers Kieran and James come in after Kieran injures his knee in a bout

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joe and Emma from Kent have been married for 21 years. After years of holidaying in Spain, they've decided to sell up in the UK and make a permanent move along with their daughter Gracie to Spain's Mar Menor. Armed with a budget of 90,000, Ben Hillman sets out to find the pair the perfect property

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: TV presenter Anneka Rice and pop star Cheryl Baker go head to head as they each create a pair of leather earrings in the timed challenge, and TV personality Jo Wood takes on broadcaster Natasha Kaplinsky in a pyrography craft-off

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karen and Julian run a B&B in Cornwall and although they've never been to Naxos, they've decided it's the perfect place for a holiday home. Scarlette Douglas sets out to help them find the perfect pad on a budget of 215,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the end of the summer season approaches, a Portuguese restaurant loses an important staff member. There's a big dilemma facing a pony trekking business in Italy, while a French B&B has big expansion plans

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit the Cotswolds, where they unearth a mystery item that looks like a fish tank, but turns out to have a very different use entirely

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to the Chiltern Hills in Buckinghamshire to meet Adam and Mandy, who run a classic car restoration business. Henry uncovers an anvil, while Simon finds an old brown dresser, which he thinks could become a wildlife sanctuary for birds and insects

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives search for the beneficiaries to an unclaimed estate worth 11,000, but they have their work cut out as the deceased has one of the most popular Welsh surnames - Jones. Plus, the hunt for the relatives of a Cheshire man reveals a family connection to the golden age of British coach travel

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team competes against the efforts of rival probate researchers to close the case of a Hampshire man who left behind a valuable estate. Plus, the gruesome history of a barber's shop is revealed as an enormous family tree is explored

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Wisteria House, Hampshire, where owner Jane Faulkner invites guests to her establishment. Later, the group members try their hands at milking a cow, while 25-year-old Zak causes surprises when he reveals his years of hospitality experience

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit The Living Room B&B in Bournemouth on their second night, which is co-owned by 25-year-old Zak Busby-Pelekanou. While at the establishment, Mike and Charlie have a hairy issue, and Jane and Amy encounter a spider, before getting to grips with an ambitious breakfast menu

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Valley Hotel in Anglesey, where owner Mike Lewis hopes his five-star pedigree will help him reap dividends in the competition. After a visit to a local RNLI station, guests Jane and Amy are left feeling sluggish when they spot an unwanted visitor in their room, and their criticism leaves the hosts looking for answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: David and Elvira Barratt welcome the contestants to Barratt's at Ty'n Rhyl, Denbighshire, but the group has an unpleasant experience on arrival. The guests take part in an activity at a local cookery school where they are taught the art of preparing and cooking sheep's testicles. However, come feedback time, the hosts are left feeling distraught

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet to find out who earned the most and have it out with their rivals. Jane and Amy kick off proceedings with a gripe over David and Elvira's coffee criticism, yet are confronted themselves by Zak, who has a score to settle. Mike and Charlie of the Valley Hotel want to get to the bottom of an unwanted intruder during their stay at Wisteria House, and the ladies are challenged again regarding their cleanliness comments. Emotions run high as the cash is counted and the winner is revealed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: In Liverpool, Harringtons, a tapas restaurant with an international twist, kick off the competition with mum-and-son duo James and Lisa offering good fun, family vibes and an eclectic mix of food. Day two sees Andres and Dave taking the reins and trying to impress at their Spanish restaurant Esto Es Espaa. Finally, it's the turn of Jisha and Sabuji from Kerala Kitchen to show how they do it southern Indian style

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: With the holiday season fast approaching, Stephanie enlists close family friend Gerry and her mother Isobel to get her B&B room finished in time. Lee and Belinda plan to create a new outdoor events space for their first wedding booking. To go the extra mile, the south London couple aim to construct a water feature, and call on Dick for advice - but things don't go to plan. Jayne and Steve rope in their friends to finish renovating the ground floor, and the promise of a thank-you meal keeps spirits high, although dinner could end up being served cold

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Ben and Rachel Hammond have spent a year searching London for somewhere exciting to live with their two daughters, and they have finally stumbled on a 1950s home on a unique plot, situated within the leafy depths of a park in the south of the city. The only problem is the house itself - an ugly, inefficient and uninspiring property - and their solution is to radically transform it into a sleek, modernist masterpiece. But this is no easy task, as Kevin McCloud finds out

programme.title: Astrid: Murder in Paris
programme.desc: A woman is accused of murdering her godfather at Alcoholics Anonymous. Astrid and Raphaelle hunt for the truth, but Raphaelle winds up in the worst trouble of her career. Drama, starring Sara Mortensen and Lola Dewaere. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Rich, 35, is airlifted to the hospital after being involved in a high-speed collision on the M25, and doctors are concerned when they discover he has lost feeling below his chest and can't move his legs. Meanwhile, 36-year-old Justin has had a life-threatening accident while playing football and he is put into an induced coma while a CT scan is carried out, which reveals a potentially life-threatening bleed on his brain

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This edition focuses on a mother's role in different family units. Jacob, 20, arrives in resus with suspected internal bleeding after crashing his car into a wall at high speed, while Joan, 82, is treated for a head wound after tripping down the stairs at home, and seven-year-old Jackson has a suspected infection on his cheek. Documentary following life inside the A&E department of St George's in south-west London, focusing on patients, their families and the staff dealing with the emergencies

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts another round of light-hearted words-and-numbers fun, with Sean Lock and Katherine Ryan taking on Jon Richardson and David Mitchell. Nick Helm is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley does the adding up

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and Henning Wehn compete against Jon Richardson and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Tom Allen joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters with 'help' from Joe Wilkinson

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Rich, 35, is airlifted to the hospital after being involved in a high-speed collision on the M25, and doctors are concerned when they discover he has lost feeling below his chest and can't move his legs. Meanwhile, 36-year-old Justin has had a life-threatening accident while playing football and he is put into an induced coma while a CT scan is carried out, which reveals a potentially life-threatening bleed on his brain

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty finds out that shellfish consumed by millions have been feeding on plastic discarded in the sea, with shocking global implications. Kate Quilton finds out whether the makers of Marmite can really predict whether people will love or hate their distinctive yeast-based spread, as claimed in their latest TV advert, and Tebbutt aims to solve the age-old mystery of how to smoothly extract ketchup from a bottle - by running across a pond of custard

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: George Robertson from Bedfordshire has visited Majorca's Port de Pollensa more than 30 times down the years, and the area has captured his heart. Now, with the help of his best friend Diane, he's looking for the perfect second home on the island. Property expert Jasmine Harman lines up five options for his 155,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gary and Janet are ready to take early retirement together in eastern Spain, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties in Orihuela for their budget of 140,000

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Who'd a Thought It in Grafty Green, Kent, where partners Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin hope to impress their fellow guests. On arrival, Liz and Brian are excited over their two hot tubs, and Jackie and Paul are more than happy with the complimentary champagne. However, Matthew and Liam are underwhelmed by the cleanliness levels

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the New Osborne Hotel in Blackpool on their second night, where proprietor Matthew Bracegirdle and entertainment manager Liam hope their guests feel at home in their family friendly establishment. However, Jackie and Paul are unimpressed by their small room, and Joe and Alex find the cleanliness levels lacking

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Fairy Falls Hotel in Trefriw, Conwy County Borough, where B&B newcomers Jackie and Paul Langshaw hope to impress the other contestants. They take their guests to a local maze in the afternoon and, after an uncomfortable night's sleep for Alex, some of the breakfast orders are misplaced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Husband and wife Liz and Brian Jardine welcome their guests to The Great Trewern B&B, Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where they enjoy the quiet life. Joe and Alex feel far away from it all, but the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress the other guests. At dinner, talk turns to first impressions and it appears it is all water under the bridge for Jackie and Joe, but she remains upset with the feedback Matthew and Liam gave her

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one final time to find out what they have been paid. Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin kick things off by confronting Matthew Bracegirdle and Liam Halewood about their comments regarding the cleanliness of their establishment, and Jackie and Paul Langshaw complain about their poor breakfast score

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Bristol with Josh and Anna, who are buying their first home together, and Sue and Samira, who are moving from London to a city they barely know for a change of pace in their life. However, one couple have a budget that falls short of their requirements, while the other pair appear to lack confidence when it comes to making a decision

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: The journey concludes along the west coast of California where Matt learns about the unique growing conditions that make Castroville the 'artichoke capital of the world'. He tries his hand at a different form of farming on America's only ocean-based abalone farm. Further north in Salinas Valley, Matt helps with milking at the last family dairy farm on the coast that produces Monterey Jack cheese. He takes to the water to see a pod of grey whales before paying a visit to the tallest living things on earth, coastal redwood trees, which can grow to 380 feet tall and 29 feet wide

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Kerry Bolwell-Williams kicks off a week of dinner parties in the Welsh valleys, where she hopes that a full choir and a simple menu will impress her guests and make her an early contender for the 1,000 prize. However, she does not react well when it is suggested that her home has a rather distinctive smell

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food-lover and theme park fan Dave Morris hosts the second dinner party in the Welsh valleys, hoping his home-grown herbs, hand-picked fruit and complicated menu will win him the 1,000 cash prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Shop owner Tasnim Sardar hosts the third night of the competition in the Welsh valleys, and hopes her Pakistani-inspired party will secure her the 1,000 prize. Financial advisor Gill Leonard likes her curries to be hot and spicy, and is particularly pleased by Tasnim's curried cauliflower

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ryan Woodward hosts on the fourth night in the Welsh valleys and has put a lot of thought into his evening, but each of his courses goes wrong - from a bread blunder to a clam crisis. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following the stories of three patients being treated for cardiac problems at St George's Hospital, south-west London. Corey has suffered cardiac arrest while playing ice hockey, prompting doctors to keep the 24-year-old in an induced coma to prevent further damage to his brain. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. In the Monsal Valley in Derbyshire, Paul tries to teach Bob how to fly fish for wild rainbow trout, and the pair reflect on their humble beginnings, their careers and their comedy contemporaries. Later, Bob cooks Paul his very personal recipe of tuna melanie on the river bank, and it soon transpires his cooking is a lot more successful than his fishing

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Cameras follow old friends Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer as they continue on their angling trip round the UK. This time, Paul and Bob fish the river Wensum in Norfolk for roach, but as the pair struggle up and down the riverbanks, they begin to realise how age is starting to take its toll on their physicality. After staying overnight in a disused train station and visiting a local pub, the pair decide to challenge each other to a fishing competition the following day, where the winner gets a very special culinary treat

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Lucy goes on a wild night out in London with TV personality Alan Carr, while back in Hebden Bridge, Jon spends the night with his best friend, Matt Forde

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: The couple are thrilled when they are finally invited to Jonathan Ross's Halloween party, where Lucy is very excited to meet Jason Donovan

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the unconventional quiz, in which Jason Manford, Jimmy Carr and Victoria Coren Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme of 'Oddballs'. During the course of the show, the panellists encounter some vegetarian goatsuckers. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Susan Calman, Hal Cruttenden and Romesh Ranganathan on an edition of the comedy quiz first aired in July 2014. The panellists give their take on that week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck, Phill Jupitus and Sean Lock join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the subject of games, with points awarded for the answers host Stephen Fry finds most interesting

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian explores all aspects of light bulbs, gravy boats, dot-to-dot books and Lego as the programme taking a light-hearted look at modern life concludes

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former footballer David James, stand-up comedian Rhys James, ex-track and field athlete Denise Lewis and comedian, actress, and writer Isy Suttie test their skills in a variety of trivia-based games, with the week's ultimate winner finally declared

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Improv comedy show with Colin Mochrie, Ryan Stiles, Jeff Davis, Brad Sherwood and Aisha Tyler and a special appearance by Cheryl Hines

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler welcomes extreme sports star Tony Hawk to the comic improv show, alongside regulars Wayne Brady, Heather Anne Campbell, Colin Mochrie and Ryan Stiles

programme.title: Driving Wars
programme.desc: Friends from Birmingham take on a team of farmers in the competition that fuses video gaming and real-life motorsport. Colin Murray presents

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Big Zuu is back on the road and this time he's heading west to Bristol, the hometown of TV presenter and social media queen Maya Jama

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: 50 teams take on an intense course in the shadow of the Iowa state capital - how will they survive the incredibly steep start ramp, an unforgiving kicker, and a unique split course?

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: The return of the thrilling adventure series. Actor Will Mellor cajoles one of his best mates - comedian Keith Lemon - to join him on a high-octane road trip in Albania.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Certified 'indoorsman' Phil Wang convinces best friend Pierre Novellie - also not much better at outdoor stuff - to join him in Lesotho, Africa's Kingdom in the Sky

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy about the romance between a couple with differing cultures and backgrounds. Gavin and Stacey have flirted for months on the phone at work but have never met up - until she travels from Wales to London to see him. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star alongside Rob Brydon, Alison Steadman, Ruth Jones and James Corden

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers' tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. Stacey finally agrees to return to Billericay with her beau, prompting his proud mum Pamela to set about cleaning the house from top to bottom. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Stacey's brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Sitting side by side on the banks of the Upper Tamar Lakes, Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer fish for the predatory perch. Bob notices that Paul has far more superior seating, which causes momentary tension between the pair. The tables are turned when Bob reveals this week's accommodation - leaving Paul almost speechless. The following day the duo brave the open sea and have a very surprising catch. They celebrate in the only way possible in the south-west of England - it's not particularly heart-healthy but it proves to be very tasty

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer fly to Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh, to fish for pike, which eluded them in the previous series. They take to the waters of Lough Erne in their search for this mighty fish, guided by the very experienced Pascal. They discuss their respective bad habits and Bob gives Paul a thorough health update, before they retire to a local hostelry to sample traditional refreshments. Paul demonstrates how to perform life-saving CPR and Bob gives him a glimpse into his future by telling his fortune in an ancient Irish manner

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob fish for grayling on the stunning River Ure in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales, where they talk about their plans for retirement and Bob reveals his hopes and dreams for the future. Together they meet the surgeon who performed Bob's life-saving heart bypass and re-enact all the drama of the operating table - in a local pub. In the evening, Paul organises some entertainment, while Bob struggles to cook a heart healthy dinner to round off their trip

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Searching for some tech to fix Starbug's faulty steering, Lister and his crew dock at a research station where scientists claim to have manufactured a 'cure' for evil. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny-John Jules and Chris Barrie

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The team are arrested by the Mechanoid Intergalactic Liberation Front, while Kryten is given a new life of pampering and luxury. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A ship from the 23rd century is washed up from the past and the Dwarfers run into a crew where criticism is illegal. When they protest they are arrested and threatened with draining of all critical thoughts. However, Rimmer's bitterness about his childhood comes in handy in beating the draining machine, his inner critic and the system, at least for a while. Johnny Vegas guest stars

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee wants to create the perfect Christmas for Lucy, so he invites her to spend the holiday in a cosy old country house that used to belong to his dear, dead old aunt - and to make it a proper family get-together, he invites along her parents and dipsy friend Daisy. But the Christmas spirit is in short supply when Lucy discovers that the cottage has not been lived in for years - and it isn't long before they have sensed a spooky presence. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix star in this festive special of the sitcom, with Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant. Festive edition from 2013

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, Lee and Lucy - who is three days overdue with their first baby - find themselves mistakenly caught up in a robbery at a local department store. Alongside them are Lee's dad, Frank, dressed as Santa's elf, Daisy and neighbours Toby and Anna. Locked in and faced with a dangerous armed robber wearing a Father Christmas mask, they have to come up with an escape plan. But will Lee's poorly conceived ideas get them into even more trouble? One-off Christmas special of the comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage

programme.title: Comedy Against Living Miserably
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy special, hosted and headlined by Joel Dommett, with support from Kiri Pritchard-Mclean, John Robins and Judi Love

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an 'Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer

programme.title: Secrets of Britain

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: In blacked-out London, four young women are murdered in similar circumstances to Jack the Ripper's crimes. Plus, the legend of the Bermuda Triangle

programme.title: World War Two From Above
programme.desc: For the first time, the theatre of war takes place mainly in the air. From the invention of radar to Hitler's 'Wonder Weapons', all means are good to bring the enemy down

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britain's finest engineering

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the last leg of Michael Portillo's long journey from Wexford to Westport, a fashionable Victorian seaweed bath is followed by a steamy scene in Ballina. On tenterhooks in Foxford, Michael discovers the visionary charity of an entrepreneurial nun, learns of a double tragedy at Clew Bay and begins a pilgrimage to the summit of Croagh Patrick, Ireland's holy mountain

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on train journeys through Edwardian Britain, exploring the grand estates of Norfolk and a bivouac on Brownsea Island on the way. He also learns the ropes aboard an Edwardian wherry on the Norfolk Broads

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins in the ruinous gardens at Aberglasney House near Llandeilo before riding shotgun in the driver's cab on one of the most scenic routes in Britain. Over the border in Leominster, Herefordshire, he steps out onto the dance floor at the Lion Hotel Ballroom, where a grand ball was held to celebrate the opening of the Ludlow to Hereford railway, and finishes this leg of his journey at a traditional cider house in Hereford

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins underground at Big Pit coal mine in Blaenavon, where he discovers how Victorians toiled night and day to power the Industrial Revolution. On the River Usk, he learns about 19th-century developments in angling before heading to Ascott-under-Wychwood in Oxfordshire - once the scene of a farm labourers' dispute that ended in rioting. Michael concludes this leg of his journey at Blenheim Palace

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The story of a bear that fought alongside the Polish army, which became a terrifying modern myth among the German army during the Second World War

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: The life of the Bolton steeplejack, explaining how his TV career began and exploring his passion for steam engines. The opening episode sees him working on the spectacular demolition that would set him on the road to fame

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores an Edwardian utopia in Letchworth, where he meets a fourth generation citizen who introduces him to the town's community spirit. He then heads towards London, and discovers a favoured haunt of King Edward VII, before sampling the monarch's favourite tipple, the King's Ginger

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Croydon, where he hears the story of a mixed-race composer who was once celebrated but is now forgotten. At Three Bridges station, he is delighted to find a recently built depot and its fleet of new Class 700 trains - and is given the great honour of washing one down. In Lewes, he makes a beeline for Charleston, the home of artists Vanessa Bell and Duncan Grant, and in Shoreham-by-Sea, Michael discovers how magnificent Edwardians in flying machines took off from the oldest licensed airport in the country

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in the heart of academia in Oxford, Michael Portillo visits the Bodleian library to see some Victorian treasures, including Mary Shelley's Frankenstein manuscript and a pocket-sized edition of Bradshaw's Companion. At Bicester, he investigates two new rail projects, finds out about Victorian philanthropy in Bedford and finishes in Luton, where he explores the dark arts of the hat-maker

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Oakham in Rutland, where he learns about a noble tradition dating back to the Middle Ages and decides to take part. Heading east to Stamford, Lincolnshire, he discovers why the town is such an attractive location for period dramas, while a ghoulish scene awaits in Peterborough when he visits a Victorian operating theatre where railwaymen were treated. Michael's last stop on his journey is Christ's College at Cambridge University, where he finds out about the student days of Charles Darwin

programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls-Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home

programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores British Columbia, discovering how two superpowers nearly came to war over a pig and joining the Royal Canadian Navy to firefight on board the frigate HMCS Regina. He also explores the rich British heritage and colonial past of Victoria - the provincial capital of British Columbia - discovers the origins of the Hudson's Bay Company, helps to carve a 36- foot totem pole and learns how to head off a charging bear

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards one of the world's most famous trains, the Rocky Mountaineer, to cross the backbone of the North American continent from Kamloops to the spa resort of Banff. This magnificent journey takes him to the highest point of the 19th century transcontinental Canadian Pacific Railway line at Kicking Horse Pass, past Lake Louise and inside spiral tunnels blasted through the mountains. Along the way, Michael hears of the harsh and dangerous conditions endured by the Chinese and European labourers who built the railway, and looks back at the historic driving of the Last Spike, which completed the Canadian Pacific Railway in 1885

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a new journey on the tracks of the Ocean line to explore Canada's maritime provinces, en route to Quebec City. Along the way he dons a kilt and sporran to join in the recreation of an 18th-century Scottish Highland regiment and learns of a catastrophic explosion in Halifax harbour in 1917, which killed 2,000 people and left 25,000 homeless

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey to Quebec City, beginning by boarding the train from Nova Scotia to New Brunswick. Along the way he investigates the world's biggest tide at Hopewell Rocks and admires its dramatic rock formations and caves. He also appears to defy gravity on a magnetic hill in a 1965 Pontiac Bonneville, before joining the Elsipogtog First Nation to learn about quilting and traditional dress. He also goes fishing for oysters and helps quarry 150-year-old sandstone

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Province of Quebec, taking the Charlevoix train along the north bank of the St Lawrence River to La Malbaie. Along the way he flies over the Laurentian Mountains in a seaplane, fishes for trout and views the waterfall at Montmorency from a zipwire - and that's just the first half of this leg

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo strikes west across Manitoba into the province of Saskatchewan. High above the Prairie at Riding Mountain, he discovers how a middle-class British boy from Hastings transformed himself into an influential indigenous naturalist called Grey Owl. Deep in the Prairie, he finds a network of railways that once served the wheat farmers of Saskatchewan, and learns how communities grew up around the grain elevators used to load the crops on to rail wagons

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: A persistent door-to-door salesman makes grouchy Victor Meldrew see red - and an unending stream of junk mail through his letterbox threatens to push him over the brink into insanity. Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Angus Deayton star

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor endures a sleepless night - and naturally ensures the eternally put-upon Margaret and their neighbours share in his suffering. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby-loving Carmel hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, and she hopes to impress with a 'Six Nations' starter, a pancetta, king prawn and chorizo main, and a Key lime pie for dessert. An attempt to charm her guests backfires when she likens Ian to a psychotic killer, and the atmosphere takes a further knock after Chris gets on the wrong side of Sophie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

However, her guests show off round the table and threaten to take the attention away from the night, but Ian is highly impressed with Polly's choice of entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the turn of exuberant hair salon owner Chris to host the final dinner party in Gloucestershire with home-made treats on the menu, including a tiger prawn starter, venison for the main and a dessert of chocolate and walnut ice-cream. She is looking for space to work from home but the high prices in the area leave Kirstie struggling to find a property within budget that ticks all the boxes. Down the road, Matt and Maryellen are building a flamboyant, Brazilian-inspired home. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final evening in Milton Keynes and the dinner party is thrown by salesman Simon, who believes that his night of fine dining will impress the critical guests. However, things begin to go awry when Howard embarks on a mission to throw his plans off course, and Helen discovers a collection of awards that evidence the host's competitive nature. Meanwhile, Louise finally comes clean about her dislike of David, before the votes are cast and the winner is announced

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glasgow pair Jean and Ron hope their 'taste of Scotland' menu will impress their guests. Day two sees Colin and Craig try to claw back the limelight and jolly up the mood

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps couple Jane and David Turnbull, who have a budget of 80,000, to search for a house in Lanzarote. The property must have a lot of potential, and the pressure is on as it will eventually become their retirement home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman shows retired North Lanarkshire couple Bill and Maureen Hughes five properties in and around the town of Fort Myers, Florida, within their budget of 320,000. The pair hope to create a whole new chapter of family memories - and escape the ravages of the Scottish winter

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Linda and Charlotte Rodriguez help Julie and David, who want to swap wet winters in their Welsh caravan for a holiday haven in the Costa Blanca sun, for a budget of 115,000 euros

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: The owners of a village in France officially open after two years of renovations. Cameras catch up with the man who rescued an abandoned hamlet in Spain who could now lose half of what he bought. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple start an animal sanctuary in their village

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. Henry is barn searching on his doorstep in Oxfordshire, while Simon makes the long journey down from Liverpool. It's a 'tank off!' as Simon hatches a wacky plan to turn some old tanks into a pizza oven, while Henry turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition heads to south-east London, where first to host is 25-year-old online journalist Leah, who hopes her Mediterranean feast of mixed-mezze and lamb kleftiko will win her the 1,000 cash prize. Other contestants include art events organiser Gina, Italian personal trainer Vincenzo and pub manager Josh

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Vincenzo hosts the second night in south-east London, where he hopes to impress his guests with traditional recipes handed down through his Italian family and a spot of salsa dancing. The guests also engage in some dicey debating - ensuring there is never a dull moment to the party

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar manager Josh presents the third dinner party in south-east London, and hopes to wow his guests with a menu inspired by beer. However, they may not be too impressed to find their host's favourite tipple featuring in every course. Josh also cuts corners in the kitchen and tries to hide the fact he has had part of his main meal delivered

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Texan psychologist David hosts the fourth night of the competition in south-east London, and takes inspiration from his passion for Mexican food. However, his guests are surprised by his love of spice, and his elaborate entertainment and controversial conversations make it a party to remember

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition in south-east London it is part-time event organiser Gina's turn to throw a dinner party. She rolls out an evening of fine dining inspired by her love of cookery courses, but her culinary prowess fails to make an impact on Vincenzo, as he reveals he already ate dinner at home due to his belief that women can't cook. Meanwhile, Leah reveals a surprising beauty secret from her youth during the main course, before a self-penned poem from the host brings tears to David's eyes, and the winner is revealed

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Lincolnshire farmers David and Debbie, who are looking for a holiday home, in and around the town of Coin in Spain's Mlaga Province. The pair want a place that's big enough to house their five children and Woody, their horse, within a budget of 230,000

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Surrey, Kirstie and Phil are searching for homes to bring their househunters closer to family. Kirstie meets Lauren, who has decided to move out of her London flat to her own place in Guildford after a serious health scare. She is looking for space to work from home but the high prices in the area leave Kirstie struggling to find a property within budget that ticks all the boxes. Phil meets Eleanor, Laurence and their four-month old twin boys who are moving from Birmingham to be closer to their parents in Surbiton, but with house prices where they are searching being nearly double where they have left, Phil has his work cut out for him

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most memorable staff and patient stories filmed since 2011 at King's College Hospital and St George's in south London - places where life, love and loss unfold every day. At St George's, 22-month-old Daisy arrives by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse. She has a fractured skull, a bruise on her brain and concussion. As surgeons plan their next move, Maggie, an 83-year-old with a lust for life, has suspected sepsis, and five-year-old Roman has a pencil lead stuck in his ear. His mum Annie says Roman is charming and affectionate but can also be a handful

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A nurse shares her story of finding a career she loves, and doctors suspect a 93-year-old man with a low heart rate, dizziness and confusion may need a new pacemaker fitting. A construction worker whose finger has been crushed discusses the importance of male role models in his life, and a haemophiliac reflects on living with his condition

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: A bold new social experiment exploring whether relationships can thrive without monogamy. Cameras follow a group of currently monogamous couples as they explore for the first time whether they would be happier in an open relationship

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from late 2021, including I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, True Story, Miriam and Alan: Lost in Scotland, Tiger King 2, Close to Me and Inside Beverly Hills: The Land of the Rich and Famous. Plus, news coverage of the illegal Channel crossings and the emergence of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus. Narrated by Craig Cash

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Guests include a woman whose exes tend to marry someone else soon after the break-up, who is paired with a wedding photographer in search of a picture-perfect love of his own. A divorced grandfather trying to conceal his age connects with a business analyst who has been called 'unapproachable', while a former youth Olympic trampolinist from Essex fears his ginger hair is holding him back

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a big fat night of pointless sports trivia, with panellists Roisin Conaty, Judi Love, Joel Dommett, Dane Baptiste, Kerry Godliman and Tom Allen pondering Why Paula Radcliffe apologised to the nation, which sports have been played on the moon, and what trademarks belong to Muhammad Ali. Charles Dance heads up the celebrity question setters, alongside the kids of Mitchell Brook Primary School

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie cooks up three delicious one-pan recipes: his super-speedy smoked salmon pasta, a loaded beef burger with sweet red peppers, pickles and mustard, and gorgeously soft and sticky toffee apple buns

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Julie hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham, hoping to win over her guests with a no-nonsense menu she can prepare in advance. Joining her are tough-talking prison transport officer Tina, dreadlocked farm-dweller Stephen, superior IT manager David and glamorous beauty-school teacher Ashleigh. Alliances are quickly forged when David and Tina discover they both love a good gossip, before they turn their attention to Stephen when David compares him to a tramp. Julie overcooks her beef, but will her hosting make up for it and bag her the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty teacher Ashleigh throws the second of the week's parties in Co Durham, she hopes a menu of sophisticated dishes - along with a helping of hearts and love - will help her win the cash prize. However, cracks were already beginning to show in the diners' genial facade yesterday, and the hostess realises she must play peacemaker if she is to keep everyone from falling out

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre complaints officer and part-time farmer Stephen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham. He hopes to win the 1,000 prize money by impressing his guests with an evening on his farm, featuring a drinks reception and rustic cuisine. However, self-confessed snob Tina makes it perfectly clear what she thinks of his efforts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Prison transport officer Tina is the fourth host in Co Durham. She hopes to impress her guests with a sophisticated French menu including salmon crepes, chicken and posh peas and pear dessert. But having been highly critical of everyone else's food so far, will they now take the chance to get their own back or can she win them round?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final evening of gatherings in Co Durham sees IT manager David stage a French-themed soiree in the hope of securing the 1,000 prize. However, he soon finds his main challenge is to keep all his guests on friendly terms

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Almera, husband-and-wife duo Steve and Sharon Garner help Melanie and Arthur search for their perfect Spanish home for their budget of 295,000 euros

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Shaun Garner help Taz and Nicky find a large villa in Almera that can house them and their visiting friends and family, as well as Taz's prized collection of Cortinas

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: On Spain's Costa Blanca, mother-and-daughter duo Linda and Charlotte Rodriguez help Julie and David swap wet winters in their Welsh caravan for a holiday haven in the sun, on a budget of 115,000 euros. programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Almera, husband and wife Steve and Sharon Garner help food fans Adam and Simon find their perfect holiday home, which they eventually hope to retire to, for a budget of 180,000 euros. Over the border on the Algarve, husband and wife Andrew and Katie, who moved to Portugal a year ago and have spent the past 12 months living with Katie's father, are eager to find a place to call their own

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Colin and Richard from Glasgow love Playa del Ingles in Gran Canaria and have been holidaying there for over 20 years. With retirement approaching, they feel now's the perfect time to buy their dream holiday home there to escape the Scottish winters and spend up to six months of the year in the sunshine. Jean Johansson lines up five potential properties for their budget of 200,000, but will any of them seem the perfect place?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Charlie and Mandy first met 20 years ago on the island of Cyprus and have now decided to make it a base for regular family holidays with their two young daughters. Jonnie Irwin scours the market to show them a mix of properties for their maximum budget of 135,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth heads to Los Gigantes, Tenerife to meet ambulance dispatcher Helen and builder Andrew from Yorkshire who are looking for a holiday home. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: Danni Menzies heads to the Correze region in France to help Alan and Joe find their perfect holiday home. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Joey get trapped on the roof while waiting to watch a meteor shower. Monica's exhaustion leads to trouble with Chandler, and Rachel argues with Tag over which of them failed to post a parcel

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe encounters a suicidal office worker during her first day as a telemarketer. Ross and Monica are upset to discover their parents intend to sell their childhood home, while Rachel and Chandler blame themselves for breaking Joey's favourite chair

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The pals celebrate Rachel's 30th birthday and reminisce about their own, including Monica's attempt to hide her intoxication from her parents, and Ross's embarrassing crisis, which resulted in the purchase of a red sports car. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Twenty-five miles north of York, Julian is called to the scene of a crash in which a car careered off the road and hit a tree, with the driver pronounced dead at the scene. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit are at the forefront of a raid against suspected drug traffickers, the hunt is on for a driver who has fled the scene of a horrific crash, and Rich Precious and Sean Baxter are left lagging far behind as they chase a speeding biker. Dan Brigginshaw is on duty at Spalding's annual flower show, and Sean Brennan deals with a young man who thinks he can throw his weight around after a boozy night out

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A van thief gives officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit the runaround before taking a disastrous wrong turn. Dan joins a manhunt but finds dodgy diesel instead, while Jon wades into a late-night assault involving a pair of TV legends. programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.desc: Patients are flooding into Barnsley A&E and a woman who has come in with a stomach ache goes into labour - and she had no idea she was pregnant. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette
